emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Pair Programming
emerging_technologies.description: Advanced AI systems that work alongside human developers, offering real-time suggestions, code reviews, and even automated testing.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Increases productivity but could reduce entry-level programming jobs, necessitating a shift in education towards AI collaboration.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on developer acceptance, accuracy of AI suggestions, and integration with existing development environments.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Transport Pods
emerging_technologies.description: Small, fully autonomous pods for intra-city travel, reducing the need for personal vehicles in urban environments.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces traffic congestion, pollution, but requires significant urban infrastructure changes and public trust in autonomous systems.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory approval, infrastructure readiness, public acceptance, and cost-effectiveness.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace Interface
emerging_technologies.description: Implantable brain-computer interfaces that enhance cognitive abilities and allow direct interaction with digital devices.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for significant enhancement of human capabilities but raises ethical concerns regarding privacy and consent.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Ethical considerations, safety, and public perception of brain implants.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Solar Power Satellites
emerging_technologies.description: Satellites that collect solar energy in space and beam it back to Earth for clean, uninterrupted power supply.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could solve energy crises but involves high initial costs and geopolitical considerations regarding space usage.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological breakthroughs in space launch costs, energy transmission efficiency, and international agreements.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Enhanced Cybersecurity
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that predict, detect, and automatically respond to cyber threats in real-time.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted by corporations and governments to safeguard digital assets.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Waste Management Systems
mainstream_technologies.description: IoT-enabled bins that optimize waste collection routes, reducing operational costs and environmental impact.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in smart cities, with growing acceptance due to efficiency and cost savings.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards seamless integration of AI in daily human activities, enhancing efficiency and decision-making.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Transforms job roles, education, and productivity, but also poses challenges in ethics and employment.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in AI education, ethical AI frameworks, and regulations on AI use in workplaces.

epoch_themes.description: Focusing on technologies that make cities more livable through sustainability and autonomy.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes environmental consciousness, reduces urban pollution, but requires significant initial investment and societal adaptation.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push towards green cities, urban mobility solutions, and sustainable infrastructure development.
